      • openConnection

        public Object openConnection()
                      throws ConnectionException
        Description copied from interface: PoolableAdapter
        Open connection
        Specified by:
        openConnection in interface PoolableAdapter
        Overrides:
        openConnection in class HttpServiceAdapter
        Returns:
        An object representing an open connection. It is typical to return the adapter activity instance itself, although any other object (but null) can be returned, which will be parsed in as a parameter to invoke() and closeConnection().
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable connection failure

      • invoke

        public String invoke(Object connection,
                     String request,
                     int timeout,
                     Map<String,String> headers)
              throws ConnectionException,
                     AdapterException
        Performs the work of invoking the Web service. The main reason to override this is to control whether error conditions are retryable by throwing either ConnectionException (retry) or AdapterException (no retry).
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface PoolableAdapter
        Overrides:
        invoke in class HttpServiceAdapter
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection object created in openConnection()
        requestData - the requestData populated in getRequestData()
        Returns:
        object representing the service response
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable exception
        AdapterException - non-retriable exception
        See Also:
        PoolableAdapter.invoke(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map)

      • onSuccess

        public void onSuccess(String response)
               throws ActivityException,
                      ConnectionException,
                      AdapterException
        Overriding this method affords the opportunity to parse the response and populate process variables as needed.
        Specified by:
        onSuccess in interface PoolableAdapter
        Overrides:
        onSuccess in class PoolableAdapterBase
        Parameters:
        response - response message from the external system
        Throws:
        ActivityException - thrown when the post processing logic hits an exception that needs to fail the activity. This error is not auto-retriable, either.
        ConnectionException - this exception indicates a system connection failure (most likely between the direct interfacing system to down stream systems, as direct connection failure will not some to this method). The exception is auto-retriable.
        AdapterException - thrown when the external system responded but the response needs to be handled as a non-auto-retriable error.

        public String getAdapterInvocationErrorMessage()
        Description copied from class: PoolableAdapterBase
